pageContext.claim: “‘It looks here as though General Flynn’s defenses are incidental to something larger which is for the prosecution to figure out if it can find a path to Donald Trump without quite knowing what that crime might be. It stops looking like prosecution and more looking like...... ....a persecution of the President.’  Daniel Henninger, The Wall Street Journal. Thank you, people are starting to see and understand what this Witch Hunt is all about. Jeff Sessions should be ashamed of himself for allowing this total HOAX to get started in the first place!”
pageContext.analysis: The Russian investigation did not begin under Jeff Sessions, but in July 2016, when FBI officials learned that a Trump campaign official had acknowledged that Russian officials appeared to have purloined emails of Democrats. Trump's former national security advisor, Michael Flynn, admitted in court that he had lied about his contacts with a Russian official before Trump took office.
